name: auth_rls_initplan
title: Auth RLS Initialization Plan
description: Detects if calls to \`current_setting()\` and \`auth.<function>()\` in RLS policies are being unnecessarily re-evaluated for each row
detail: Table \`public.tickets\` has a row level security policy \`Users can view tickets based on role\` that re-evaluates current_setting() or auth.<function>() for each row. This produces suboptimal query performance at scale. Resolve the issue by replacing \`auth.<function>()\` with \`(select auth.<function>())\`. See [docs](https://supabase.com/docs/guides/database/postgres/row-level-security#call-functions-with-select) for more info.
cache_key: auth_rls_init_plan_public_tickets_Users can view tickets based on role

name: auth_rls_initplan
title: Auth RLS Initialization Plan
description: Detects if calls to \`current_setting()\` and \`auth.<function>()\` in RLS policies are being unnecessarily re-evaluated for each row
detail: Table \`public.rls_performance_metrics\` has a row level security policy \`Admins can view metrics\` that re-evaluates current_setting() or auth.<function>() for each row. This produces suboptimal query performance at scale. Resolve the issue by replacing \`auth.<function>()\` with \`(select auth.<function>())\`. See [docs](https://supabase.com/docs/guides/database/postgres/row-level-security#call-functions-with-select) for more info.

name: multiple_permissive_policies
title: Multiple Permissive Policies
description: Detects if multiple permissive row level security policies are present on a table for the same \`role\` and \`action\` (e.g. insert). Multiple permissive policies are suboptimal for performance as each policy must be executed for every relevant query.
detail: Table \`public.categories\` has multiple permissive policies for role \`authenticated\` for action \`SELECT\`. Policies include \`{"Authenticated users can manage categories","Public can view categories"}\`
